title.rendered: The original game returns for free for everyone

content.rendered:
Just in time for the tenth anniversary of Minecraft, the developer studio Mojang announces that the very first public version of the game will be playable in the browser for free.

The Aquatic: Minecraft update is underwater

On May 17, 2019, Minecraft will be ten years old, and it’s time to celebrate! The makers took this event as an opportunity to make the first version of the block building classic available to everyone free of charge.

Back on May 17th, 2009, a little indie game came out and man, was it a hit! It was not only the starting shot for an incredibly successful series of games, but also the beginning of an entire franchise.

Hardly anyone got past Minecraft in recent years. And now the last unbiased people are to be reached. Mojang is now making the original game playable in the browser for free. At least PC users can let off steam in the future, and for free! So there’s almost no excuse to at least try the game, which has become a pop culture phenomenon

Minecraft | These are the most impressive buildingsStart photo gallery(9 photos)

This version is actually the original one, that is, still with the old pixel graphics (although Minecraft was never a graphic feast), with all the bugs and the original 32 blocks to build. The nostalgic will really get their money’s worth.
